org.ow2.proactive.scheduler.common.job

Class TaskFlowJob

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ow2.proactive.scheduler.common.task.CommonAttribute
      • org.ow2.proactive.scheduler.common.job.Job
        • org.ow2.proactive.scheduler.common.job.TaskFlowJob
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    @PublicAPI
public class TaskFlowJob
extends Job
    Use this class to create your job if you want to define a task flow job.
    A task flow job or data flow job, is a job that can contain one or more task(s) with the dependencies you want.
    To make this type of job, just use the default no arg constructor, and set the properties you want to set.
    Then add tasks with the given method addTask(Task) in order to fill the job with your own tasks.
    Since:
    ProActive Scheduling 0.9
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addTask(Task task)
      Add a task to this task flow job.
      The task name must not be null as it is not by default.
      The task name must also be different for each task as it is used to identify each task result.

      If not set, the task name will be a generated one : 'task_X' (where X is the Xth added task number)
      void addTasks(List<Task> tasks)
      Add a list of tasks to this task flow job.

      • addTask

        public void addTask(Task task)
             throws UserException
        Add a task to this task flow job.
        The task name must not be null as it is not by default.
        The task name must also be different for each task as it is used to identify each task result.

        If not set, the task name will be a generated one : 'task_X' (where X is the Xth added task number)
        Parameters:
        task - the task to add.
        Throws:
        UserException - if a problem occurred while the task is being added.

      • addTasks

        public void addTasks(List<Task> tasks)
              throws UserException
        Add a list of tasks to this task flow job. The task names must not be null as it is not by default.
        The task names must also be different for each task as it is used to identify each task result.

        If not set, the task names will be generated : 'task_X' (where X is the Xth added task number)
        Parameters:
        tasks - the list of tasks to add.
        Throws:
        UserException - if a problem occurred while the task is being added.

      • getTasks

        Returns:
        the list of tasks.

      • findTerminalTasks

        public Set<Task> findTerminalTasks()
        Find terminal tasks for this workflow Terminal tasks are tasks without children and not targets of a If or Else branch
        Returns:
        a set of terminal tasks
